biography.value:
The odor of sulfur and pumice surrounds a red dragon, whose swept-back horns and spinal frill define its silhouette. Its beaked snout vents smoke at all times, and its eyes dance with flame when it is angry.

Â

source.book: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.value:
The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.value:

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

description.value:
Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} and aware of it must succeed on a [[/save wis 19 format=long]] or become &Reference[frightened]{frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

source.book: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.value:
The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} exhales &Reference[fire]{fire} in a 60-foot &Reference[cone]{cone}. Each creature in that area must make a [[/save dex 21 format=long]], taking [[/damage 18d6 type=fire average=true]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

source.book: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.value:
The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Detect. The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} makes a &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} (&Reference[prc]{Perception}) check.

Tail Attack. The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} makes a tail attack.

Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions). The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} beats its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} must succeed on a [[/save dex 22 format=long]] or take [[/damage 2d6 + 8 type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage and be knocked &Reference[prone]{prone}. The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can then fly up to half its flying speed.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.value:
Innate Spellcasting. Ashtyrranthorâs innate spellcasting ability is &Reference[cha]{Charisma}. She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no &Reference[material]{material} components:

1/day each: alarm, detect magic, gaseous form, misty step, passwall, see invisibility

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.value:
You set an alarm against unwanted intrusion. Choose a door, a window, or an area within range that is no larger than a 20-foot &Reference[cube]{cube}. Until the spell ends, an alarm alerts you whenever a Tiny or larger creature touches or enters the warded area. When you cast the spell, you can designate creatures that won't set off the alarm. You also choose whether the alarm is mental or audible.

A mental alarm alerts you with a ping in your mind if you are within 1 mile of the warded area. This ping awakens you if you are sleeping.

An audible alarm produces the sound of a hand bell for 10 seconds within 60 feet.

For the duration, you sense the presence of magic within 30 feet of you. If you sense magic in this way, you can use your action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears magic, and you learn its school of magic, if any.

The spell can penetrate most barriers, but it is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

You transform a willing creature you touch, along with everything it's wearing and carrying, into a misty cloud for the duration. The spell ends if the creature drops to 0 hit points. An incorporeal creature isn't affected.

While in this form, the target's only method of movement is a flying speed of 10 feet. The target can enter and occupy the space of another creature. The target has resistance to nonmagical damage, and it has advantage on &Reference[str]{Strength}, &Reference[dex]{Dexterity}, and &Reference[con]{Constitution} saving throws. The target can pass through small holes, narrow openings, and even mere cracks, though it treats liquids as though they were solid surfaces. The target can't fall and remains hovering in the air even when &Reference[stunned]{stunned} or otherwise &Reference[incapacitated]{incapacitated}.

While in the form of a misty cloud, the target can't talk or manipulate objects, and any objects it was carrying or holding can't be dropped, used, or otherwise interacted with. The target can't attack or cast spells.
Briefly surrounded by silvery mist, you teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space that you can see.

A passage appears at a point of your choice that you can see on a wooden, plaster, or stone surface (such as a wall, a ceiling, or a floor) within range, and lasts for the duration. You choose the opening's dimensions: up to 5 feet wide, 8 feet tall, and 20 feet deep. The passage creates no instability in a structure surrounding it.

When the opening disappears, any creatures or objects still in the passage created by the spell are safely ejected to an unoccupied space nearest to the surface on which you cast the spell.

For the duration, you see &Reference[invisible]{invisible} creatures and objects as if they were visible, and you can see into the Ethereal Plane. Ethereal creatures and objects appear ghostly and translucent.
